title: 'Let's throw the kitchen sink at them' - Jackson Hastings out to complete remarkable turnaround with Grand Final victory for Salford
text:
When Jackson Hastings swapped Sydney for Salford last July, never could he have imagined that 15 months later he would be running out at Old Trafford in a Super League Grand Final.

Not in a million years.

Discarded by Sydney Roosters and then thrown out of Manly Sea Eagles following a highly-publicised off-field incident, the 23-year-old scrum-half arrived in England with a reputation for trouble.

Such has been his impact for Ian Watson's Red Devils, though, in inspiring their extraordinary rise from perennial no-hopers to Grand Finalists, that Hastings could now be officially recognised as the competition's best player.

The annual Super League awards take place in Manchester on Sunday night and Hastings is the overwhelming favourite to land the coveted Steve Prescott Man of Steel award.

“If I win it, I don’t know if I would be able to talk,” says Hastings, pivotal again during Friday's comprehensive 28-4 win at defending champions Wigan which sealed a date with St Helens in next Saturday's title decider.
